lexUnit.name: excited.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: filled with feelings of enthusiasm and eagerness

sentence.text: We grew more and more excited .
Paddington grew more and more excited as he listened .
I remembered that Tansy had said something about a pendant and Topaz being quite excited about it .
So we 're quite excited about it and also it 's quite a major problem .
I 'm just so excited , because he says I can be in charge of it .
Auguste sat in the small balcony with his mother and father , for once not noticing the unaccustomedness of their best clothes , so excited were they .
` They say the king 's left Welshpool with a small escort ahead of the army , " volunteered a boy a yard or so in front of them , turning an excited face .
The remaining men were just preparing to leave when suddenly a young man called Laban Tall rushed into the malthouse , almost too excited to speak .
Then , having shown the plate to various not very excited colleagues , he resumed his holiday .
` Right now I 'm feeling very excited . "
In a minute Sir Wilfrid returned , looking very excited .
` The problems start when he becomes more excited and frisky than usual .
Some horses become excited and upset if something goes a bit wrong when they are in harness , such as chains or ropes becoming entangled around their feet .
At the same time they could become excited about house matches or school matches and take part in such events with earnest aggressiveness .
Rescued dogs are often somewhat nervous of people , and yet may also become excited to see you , when you have been out , for example .
There have been some most tempting glimpses of it when you have become excited about a design or angry with yourself for a failure to meet your own high standards . "
You ca n't get very excited when she brings home half-price loo rolls and stale cough sweets .
And everybody gets very excited , because three hundred and fifty kilos in Durham tomorrow morning sounds like a good pay day .
And suddenly they found themselves talking the sort of language that all of us can understand , and they got quite excited about this .
Donna seemed quite excited about it .
I could n't wait for the pictures to come out , I was so excited to see them .
` I am so excited about seeing my sons again .
Alexandra was extremely excited , over-excited in Janet 's opinion .
` They are naturally excited about getting the championship back after 33 years , " he said .
Sir Jack Brabham says he 's never been so excited about a new motor car and the challenge is to go and take on the best
I have been looking forward to her visit for weeks and was very excited when I met her .
Just like trippers heading for the Isle of Wight , they had packed their picnic baskets and sat chatting on deck as their excited children played .
Bang on cue , she strode out on to the stage , feeling none of the terror that had crippled her last performance , the excited cheers of the children bringing a beaming smile to her face .
The three of them started walking , followed by the excited crowd .
Salesmen were still tramping the aisles of the carriages , shouting over the excited chatter of the crowd , the squawking of chickens and bleating of goats .
The excited smile on her face told Ingrid that the girl was enjoying herself .
Perhaps he was just imagining the undercurrent of nostalgia , he told himself as he looked at Cora-Beth 's flushed , excited face .
Benjamin nodded and stared where an ostler was trying to calm an excited horse .
This man introduced me to an agent who did n't look all that excited to see me and was only obliging a friend .
I was working late on one of these bad nights when an excited Dr Laurent rushed into my office .
I feel excited when I come up with something that I can have Jack to help me with , I 'm always ready to hear what he has .
And I 'm really excited about it and there 's lots of interest , I think this places are taken up already .
It was the prospect of finding gold that induced these excited men to make such frantic efforts to open out the barrow " .
Breakfast was quite a social affair as we were frequently visited by new found friends in the shape of two fat and very vocal geese , a young swan and a bevy of excited ducks .
Her head turned restlessly on the pillow as she strove to distance herself from the increasingly excited voice of the commentator and the air-splitting whine of the high-revving engines .
But now she looked excited .
Her headache seemed to be getting worse and worse , and Raffaella 's command of English slipped as she grew increasingly excited .
It was about five o 'clock , and the shadows of the March evening were beginning to fall , when an excited rustic rushed into our room .
